reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Ahana Phase III on Elimination of Mother to Child Transmission of HIV by 2024 and Supply Chain Management System Strengthening Project for HIV/AIDS and TB products

description.narrative: India - TB/HIV - Plan International (India Chapter) - Plan India. This program has the following goals: Elimination of Mother to Child Transmission of HIV. Strengthening of supply chain mangement system for high quality TB, ARV drugs and diagnostics availability at all levels. The objectives of this program are: To facilitate expansion of HIV testing access by building capacities of peripheral health workers and converging HIV testing with primary health services at all VHNDs, urban health facilities and in private facilities towards attaining universal access. To ensure effective convergence of HIV testing- Treatment and Care and support services through a “Community Based Single Window Service Delivery Model (CBSWM)” for HIV positive pregnant women and HIV exposed babies till 18 months. To ensure a sustainable PPTCT service delivery and develop a convergent and resilient data management system through continuous monitoring and mentoring of the facilities for quality record keeping and bring them ‘level ready’ for EMTCT data validation exercise. To provide third party logistics services (3PL for distribution of all commodities centrally procured by NACO/CTD under NACP/NTEP as per the requirement of programs. To provide technical assistance at national and state level to strengthen the system through people, process and technology for sustainability of NACO and CTD Supply Chain Management. To support NACO/CTD and implementing partner to strengthen the electronic Logistics Management Information System (eLMIS) for essential data recording and reporting for real time visibility and informed decision making

title.narrative: Percentage of HIV-exposed infants receiving a virological test for HIV within 2 months of birth
Percentage of other vulnerable populations that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of HIV-positive women who received ART during pregnancy and/or labour and delivery
Percentage of consignments delivered on-time and in-full among the total number of consignments expected to be delivered for the three diseases during the reporting period
